title.narrative: 4.3. SOCIETY & PRIVATE SECTOR ENGAGEMENT

description.narrative: By 2021, Peruvian society and the private sector will have improved knowledge of the rights of adolescents and children and will know how to protect them., which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, adolescents and children will continue to be recognized by society and the Peruvian State as subjects of law and will be prioritized in social regulations, policies and budgets.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, Peruvian society and the private sector will have improved knowledge of the rights of adolescents and children and willknow how to protect them.

description.narrative: UNICEF usedthe media, digitalplatforms,and trusted social networksto shareinformationaboutchildren and adolescentsandcare practicesand to promotevaccination. UNICEF constantly advocated for thesafe return toin-personclasses,in collaboration withother actors, and mobilized 65,783 adolescents on child rights. Thefoundationswereestablished to promote strategicshared valueinitiatives with the private sector, with a view to capitalizing opportunities in the new2022-2026cooperation cycle,focusingonEducation, Health, Protection, ResilientEnvironments,and Innovation.A Business Advisory Council was launched to leverage networks, reach, influence, and capacities for accelerating programmatic results. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/12/2021
